that often psychoanalysis is simply a
game of hide and seek in which you
continue to relinquish responsibility
for your actions and reality and assign
the basic cause to some area of the
psyche hidden in the dark force of the
past
then you give yourself the task of
finding the secret
in so doing you never think of looking
forward in the conscious mind
since you are convinced that all deep
answers lie far beneath and moreover
that your consciousness is not only
unable to help you but will often send
up camouflage instead
so you play the game
when and if you manage to change your
beliefs in that deep deceptive framework
then any suitable forgotten event from
the past will be used as a catalyst
one would do as well as another
the basic beliefs however were always in
your conscious mind and the reason for
your behavior you simply had not
examined its content with the
realization that your beliefs were not
necessarily reality but often your
conception of it
and at some time in psychoanalysis you
are often programmed to believe that the
unconscious being the source of such
dark secrets cannot be counted upon as
any bed of creation or inspiration
and so you are denied the help that the
inner portion of the self could give to
your consciousness
usually when you do examine your
conscious mind you do so looking through
or with your own structured beliefs
the knowledge that your beliefs are not
necessarily reality will allow you to be
aware of all the data that is
consciously available to you
i'm not telling you examine your
thoughts so frequently in such vigor
that you get in your own way
but you are not fully conscious unless
you are aware of the content of your
conscious mind
i'm also emphasizing the fact that the
conscious mind is equipped to receive
information from the inner self as well
as the exterior universe
i'm not in telling you to inhibit
thoughts or feelings
i am asking that you become aware of
those you have
realize that they form your reality
concentrate upon those that give you the
results that you want
if you find all of this difficult you
can also examine your physical reality
in all of its aspects
realize that your physical experience
and environment is the materialization
of your belief
if you find great exuberance health
effective work abundance smiles on the
faces of those you meet then take it for
granted that your beliefs are beneficial
if you see a world that is good people
that you like take it for granted again
that your beliefs are beneficial
but if you find poor health a lack of
meaningful work a lack of abundance a
work of sorrow of evil then assume that
your beliefs are faulty and begin
examining them

reality but for now we are dwelling upon

chapter was that your conscious beliefs
are extremely important
